properties.Name: InsuranceRequirementType
properties.Description:
The type of requirement under the associated insurance product based on state requirements.

Ex:
- Required / Mandatory / Compulsory
- Optional
- Included At No Cost
- State Retained Limit

where:

The Retained Limit is the amount of damages an Insured must assume and pay for any occurrence if:
  
   1) No Underlying Insurance is required

      and

   2) No other insurance applies to the occurrence

Retained Limits vary by state. The state applying to the insured is determined by the address in the declarations and the dollar amount shown for the associated state.

E.g.:
COMPULSORY AUTO INSURANCE
The minimum amount of auto liability insurance that meets a state law. Financial responsibility laws in every state require all automobile drivers to show proof, after an accident, of their ability to pay damages up to the state minimum. In compulsory liability states this proof, which is usually in the form of an insurance policy, is required before you can legally drive a car.

Columns.Name: InsuranceRequirementTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Insurance Requirement Type.

Columns.Name: InsuranceRequirementTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Insurance Requirement Type.

Columns.Name: InsuranceRequirementTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Insurance Requirement Type.
